history.content:
Have you done any internships so far? And which courses are you planning to take?

I'd suggest internships over the upper division cs courses offered this summer. I'd also suggest internship over the core lower division courses, because you get experience, but it's a much tougher choice. I'm not an expert and I'd suggest talking to Lily or Sarah. They know best.

Hi there, I'm curious about what your major is. If you're a CS minor looking to work in the field, I would think an internship would be important, but then again, it's important to weigh whether it is possible to graduate in summer rather than spring. Is it the minor courses that would push you into summer? I would urge you to speak with your major adviser to try to plan the remainder of your courses. Ultimately it's up to you, but an internship does seem important!

I've been set on the idea to take two CS classes this summer in order to lighten the stress for my senior year and graduate on time. However I keep getting opportunities to apply to summer internships this summer, I thought it was too late but I guess some people are still looking. I thought I made up my mind but now I'm wondering what's more worth it, taking these two classes to graduate on time (Spring 2018), orrr do an internship this summer, and probably have to take a class or two the Summer after I graduate (Summer 2018). 

I'm also a CS Minor wanting a career in the field but doesn't necessarily have to be engineering or programming, if that makes a difference.
history.subject: Advice for summer before Senior year

edit: I haven't had any internships yet. (I know, first mistake)
